author: felix314159_
content:
> So, my strict interpretation for holesky is that
> current should be paris
> next should be shanghai 
> last should be bpo2
> which I think is what nethermind and geth are showing.
yes exactly. and re-reading the eip it says 'activation time: [..] If a fork is activated at genesis, the value 0 is used' so i think i prefer netherminds response.

> This will be different for other testnets
yes, if a different genesis.json is used in some testnet the response can be different. but the eip clearly defines what the correct response is

> We want next to be bpo1 at this point in time don't we?
no, like you said 'next' should be shanghai. if bpo1 should be next then the EIP has to be reworded

> listing all forks might be a better approach afterall
are you referring to the genesis.json or to the eth_config response? if you refer to the response i agree with you, it would be way easier for testing if the reponse we get is complete. we currently have to re-run our tests whenever 'current' changes and 'next' != 'last' to ensure that each client uses the same 'next'
